qas.question: What kind of service are police?
When were police used to protect the class system?
What problem do many police forces have?
What kind of service aren't police?
When aren't police used to protect the class system?
What asset do many police forces have?
When were police used to protect the civilian system?

context: Law enforcement, however, constitutes only part of policing activity. Policing has included an array of activities in different situations, but the predominant ones are concerned with the preservation of order. In some societies, in the <a2_0><b6_0><b8_0>late 18th and early 19th centuries<b8_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/>, these developed within the context of maintaining the class system and the protection of private property. Many police forces suffer from police <a3_0><b7_0>corruption<b7_0/><a3_0/> to a greater or lesser degree. The police force is usually a <a1_0><b5_0>public sector<b5_0/><a1_0/> service, meaning they are paid <a0_0><b4_0>through taxes<b4_0/><a0_0/>.
